dataMoveZtrmm.h File Reference

This file contains various data movement functions needed for ZTRMM. More...

#include "defC66.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

Functions

void arrangeDataUAZtrmm (doublecomplex *restrict ptrA, int kLoc, int mCnt, int kCnt, int flagDiagisU)
 zero out lower part of A moved to internal memory (size MPARTITION by KPARTITION) for upper triangular A. This function also sets diagonal elements to unity if necessary. This function is used to properly properly arrange A in L2 memory for upper triangular A when C is calculated.
void arrangeDataLTAZtrmm (doublecomplex *restrict ptrA, int kLoc, int mCnt, int kCnt, int flagDiagisU)
 zero out lower part of A moved to internal memory (size KPARTITION by MPARTITION) for lower triangular A. This function also sets diagonal elements to unity if necessary. This function is used to properly properly arrange A in L2 memory for lower triangular A when the transpose of C is calculated.
void arrangeDataLAZtrmm (doublecomplex *restrict ptrA, int kLoc, int mCnt, int kCnt, int flagDiagisU)
 zero out lower part of A moved to internal memory (size MPARTITION by KPARTITION) for lower triangular A. This function also sets diagonal elements to unity if necessary. This function is used to properly properly arrange A in L2 memory for lower triangular A when C is calculated.
void arrangeDataUTAZtrmm (doublecomplex *restrict ptrA, int kLoc, int mCnt, int kCnt, int flagDiagisU)
 zero out lower part of A moved to internal memory (size MPARTITION by KPARTITION) for upper triangular A. This function also sets diagonal elements to unity if necessary. This function is used to properly properly arrange A in L2 memory for upper triangular A when the transpose of C is calculated.

Detailed Description

This file contains various data movement functions needed for ZTRMM.

This file contains definitions of various data movement functions needed for ZTRMM.
